lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Nailong.Nailong.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Nailong.Nailong.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Constructs a new Nailong chatbot with the specified storage file path.
* @param filePath Path to the file where tasks will be stored.
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed.
* @param index Index of the task to mark as done (0-based).
* Marks the task at the specified index as not completed.
* @param index Index of the task to mark as undone (0-based).
* Handles the mark command from user input.
* @param parts Array containing the command and task number.
* Handles the unmark command from user input.
* @param parts Array containing the command and task number.
* Handles the todo command from user input.
* Creates and adds a new Todo task.
* @param input Full command string containing todo description.
* Handles the deadline command from user input.
* Creates and adds a new Deadline task.
* @param input Full command string containing deadline description and due date.
* Handles the event command from user input.
* Creates and adds a new Event task.
* @param input Full command string containing event description, start, and end times.
Task task = new Event(desc, from, to);
* Handles the delete command from user input.
* @param parts Array containing the command and task number.
* Handles the find command from user input.
* Searches for tasks containing the specified keyword.
* @param parts Array containing the command and search keyword.
* Processes user commands until the user types "bye".
* Main method to start the Nailong application.
* Saves all tasks from the task list to the storage file.
* Creates the necessary directories and file if they don't exist.
* @param taskList TaskList containing tasks to be saved.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* If the file doesn't exist, creates it and returns an empty task list.
* Handles corrupted data by skipping invalid lines and displaying warnings.
* @return ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
System.out.println("Warning: Corrupted data at line " + lineNumber + ": " + line);
* Parses a line from the storage file and creates the corresponding Task object.
* Supports Todo (T), Deadline (D), and Event (E) task types.
* @param line Line from the storage file to parse.
* @return Parsed Task object, or null if the line is empty or invalid.
* Creates the necessary parent directories and file if they don't exist.
* This method ensures the storage file path is ready for read/write operations.
Path parentPath = filePath.getParent(); // check if ./data folder exists
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param task Task to be added to the list.
* Removes and returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index Index of the task to remove (0-based).
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
* Returns the task at the specified index without removing it.
* @param index Index of the task to retrieve (0-based).
* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
* Returns the number of tasks in the task list.
* Displays a separator line in the console.
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Displays the goodbye message when the application terminates.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Displays all tasks in the provided task list.
* @param tasks TaskList containing tasks to display.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Displays confirmation message when a task is successfully added.
* @param totalTasks Total number of tasks after addition.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int totalTasks) {
System.out.println(" Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println(" Now you have " + totalTasks + (totalTasks == 1 ? " task in the list." : " tasks in the list."));
* Displays confirmation message when a task is successfully deleted.
* @param remainingTasks Number of tasks remaining after deletion.
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int remainingTasks) {
System.out.println(" Noted. I've removed this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + remainingTasks + (remainingTasks == 1 ? " task in the list." : " tasks in the list."));
* Displays error message for unknown commands and shows available commands.
System.out.println("Available commands: list, todo, deadline, event, mark, unmark, delete, bye");
* Displays confirmation message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task Task that was marked as completed.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Displays confirmation message when a task is marked as undone.
* @param task Task that was marked as incomplete.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Displays the results of a find operation.
* Shows matching tasks or a message if no matches are found.
* @param matchingTasks ArrayList of tasks that match the search criteria.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description Description of the deadline task.
* @param by Deadline date/time for the task.
* Returns the formatted string for storing the deadline task to file.
* Constructs a new Event task with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param from Start date/time of the event.
* @param to End date/time of the event.
public Event (String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the formatted string for storing the event task to file.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* Returns the status icon for the task.
* 'X' for completed tasks, ' ' for incomplete tasks.
* Marks the task as not completed.
* Returns the formatted string for storing the task to file.
* This method should be overridden by subclasses.
* Reformats a date string from dd/MM/yyyy format to MMM dd yyyy format.
* If no valid date pattern is found, returns an empty string.
* @param time Date string in dd/MM/yyyy format.
* @return Reformatted date string or empty string if no valid date found.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description Description of the todo task.
* Returns the formatted string for storing the todo task to file.
